title: Fish Week: Easy & Delicious Tilapia
summary: Fish Week: Easy & Delicious Tilapia might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 186 calories, 18g of protein, and 12g of fat. For $1.82 per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 7. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and pescatarian diet. 20 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up yogurt, tarragon, farm-raised tilapia, and a few other things to make it today. With a spoonacular score of 43%, this dish is solid. Try Super Delicious and Easy Baked Fish (Anykind), Week of Meals For College Students – Easy Roasted Chicken & Baked Macaroni & Cheese Week, and Quickie Dinner Week: Tilapia Tacos for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Preheat broiler on lowCombine1/4 cup parmesan cheese with the remaining ingredients. Coat fillets with mix and place in baking dish. Allow to marinate for 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer fillets to foiled broiling tray. Spoon marinade over top of fillets and sprinkle with remaining parmesan cheese. Broil about 6 inches from heat until topping is lightly browned and fish easily flakes, about 5 to 8 minutes.

steps.step: Combine1/4 cup parmesan cheese with the remaining ingredients. Coat fillets with mix and place in baking dish. Allow to marinate for 15 to 20 minutes.

Transfer fillets to foiled broiling tray. Spoon marinade over top of fillets and sprinkle with remaining parmesan cheese. Broil about 6 inches from heat until topping is lightly browned and fish easily flakes, about 5 to 8 minutes.
